results.title: Hello, Dolly!
results.creator_credit: Ernest Lehman, Chenault, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Gene Kelly
results.brief_description: Barbra Streisand is a knockout as Dolly Levi, the woman “who arranges things… like furniture and daffodils and lives”. The plot concerns Dolly, a young widow and professional matchmaker, who sets her sights and whatever else she can muster, on conquering tight-fisted Yonkers merchant, Horace Vandergelder, beautifully played by Walter Matthau. Spend a magical evening with the incomparabale Barbra and enjoy a great musical. Co-starring Michael Crawford.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ernest Lehman, Chenault, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Gene Kelly

results.title: Hello Universe
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Most scientists are convinced that extra-terrestrial life does exist, estimating that the galaxy is swarming with life. But the hard evidence is disappointingly scarce and as the search program gathers pace a different viewpoint is emerging - that after all the human race is alone in the universe. This program explores the probabilities of galactic neighbours.

results.title: Hello possums
results.creator_credit: Karl Steinberg, ABC-TV (Australia) and ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit
results.brief_description: In Australia they’re precious. In New Zealand they’re pests. A native to Australia, the possum does its best to adapt to the ever increasing suburban sprawl, nesting in our rooves and our backyard trees. In New Zealand however where the species was introduced to bolster the fur industry, this ‘native favourite’ becomes an ‘introduced pest’, competing for the precious food supply with New Zealand’s native birds, leading to its culling by forestry employees and hunters. Presented by Richard Morecroft.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Karl Steinberg, ABC-TV (Australia) and ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit

results.title: Hello London
results.creator_credit: George Fowler, Kinran and Sidney Smith
results.brief_description: Musical film starring Olympic gold medalist and world famous ice-skater, Sonja Henie, and co-starring Michael Wilding with Stanley Holloway. Light-hearted song and dance film on ice set in London. The cast, including Sonja, all play under their own names.

results.creator_credit: Ernest Lehman, Chenault, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Gene Kelly
results.brief_description: Barbra Streisand is a knockout as Dolly Levi, the woman “who arranges things… like furniture and daffodils and lives”. The plot concerns Dolly, a young widow and professional matchmaker who sets her sights and whatever else she can muster, on conquering tight-fisted Yonkers merchant, Horace Vandergelder, beautifully played by Walter Matthau. How she does it has to be the grandest musical there ever was! So, spend a magical evening with the incomparable Barbra and enjoy a great musicals. Also stars Michael Crawford.

results.title: Hello Australia. Episodes 9 & 10
results.creator_credit: Eve Ash, Seven Dimensions, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Paul Drane
results.brief_description: The first episode examines the Australian enthusiasm for sport and how this may be intimidating for a new migrant. Addresses the importance of standing up for one’s rights in situations where others may take advantage of a migrant’s lack of familiarity with English. The second episode outlines the importance of accepting cultural differences so as not give offence as well as examining the use of common idioms. A degree of familiarity with spoken English is assumed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eve Ash, Seven Dimensions, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Paul Drane

results.title: Hello Australia. Episodes 7 & 8
results.creator_credit: Eve Ash, Seven Dimensions, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Paul Drane
results.brief_description: Children of migrants are often the first to learn English and become familiar with customs. This program outlines how this may cause misunderstandings between parent and child. The issue of how a non-English speaker may break a law unconsciously because they are unfamiliar with the written word is discussed. The second episode looks at the different types of families which exist in Australia and skills that may be used to ensure that a person can get what they want when they go shopping. A degree of familiarity with spoken English is assumed.

results.title: Hello Australia. Episodes 5 & 6
results.creator_credit: Eve Ash, Seven Dimensions, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Paul Drane
results.brief_description: Two episodes examine the issues of privacy and what rights citizens have in their neighbourhood regarding noise. Idioms such as “giving someone a hand” are discussed and the problems that occur when different cultures have varying customs, religious practices and notions of what is considered rude or impolite. The main objectives of this language program is to support non-English speakers in learning and understanding the day to day idioms and customs found in Australia and a degree of familiarity with spoken English is assumed.

results.title: Hello Australia. Episodes 3 & 4.
results.creator_credit: Eve Ash, SBS-TV and Paul Drane
results.brief_description: Parts 3 and 4 of a series designed to give migrants more confidence in using English and to help them understand more about the Australian language and people. Short skits on subjects like going to a barbecue, ringing the emergency services, using the telephone are acted out to give a better understanding of Australian customs and the English language. Featuring George Donikian, Kay Stammers and Rod Quantok.

results.title: Hello Australia. Episodes 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Eve Ash, Seven Dimensions and Paul Drane
results.brief_description: Hello Australia is a series to develop better understanding of the English language and mainstream Australian culture and customs. Episodes 1 & 2 consist of short dramatisations of everyday situations involving the law regarding compulsory schooling until 15, sending notes to teachers when students are absent from school, Adult Migrant Education Services to improve English and therefore employment prospects in Australia, and learning English on the job. Featuring Rod Quantock as Dr Know and hosted by Kay Stammers and SBS newsreader, George Donikian.
